alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Miami-Dade and central Broward Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 913 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, or 10 miles west of Sunrise, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, Weston, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park and North Lauderdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Florida.
